flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=12000>>12000 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+12000=<<2400+12000=14400>>14400 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 14400/3=<<14400/3=4800>>4800 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 14400-4800=<<14400-4800=9600>>9600 remaining bottles of wine.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200.0, not 12000.0. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
